intro: Aulacocalyx leptactinoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed aulacocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
